intro: Maba cacharensis, commonly known as the Assam maba, is a rare flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within dense forests. Its latex contains compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
